com.github.ffalcinelli.jdivert

Class WinDivert

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ffalcinelli.jdivert.WinDivert

  • public class WinDivert
extends java.lang.Object
    A WinDivert handle that can be used to capture packets.

    The main methods are open(), recv(), send(Packet) and close().

    Created by fabio on 20/10/2016.

        Create a new WinDivert instance based upon the given filter for NETWORK layer with priority set to 0 and in DEFAULT mode (Drop and divert packet).
        Parameters:
        filter - The filter string expressed using WinDivert filter language.

                 Enums.Layer layer,
                 int priority,
                 Enums.Flag... flags)
        Create a new WinDivert instance based upon the given parameters
        Parameters:
        filter - The filter string expressed using WinDivert filter language.
        layer - The layer
        priority - The priority of the handle
        flags - Additional flags

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public WinDivert open()
               throws WinDivertException
        Opens a WinDivert handle for the given filter.
        Unless otherwise specified by flags, any packet that matches the filter will be diverted to the handle.
        Diverted packets can be read by the application with recv.

        The remapped function is WinDivertOpen: 

        
 HANDLE WinDivertOpen(
      __in const char *filter,
      __in WINDIVERT_LAYER layer,
      __in INT16 priority,
      __in UINT64 flags
 );

        For more info on the C call visit: http://reqrypt.org/windivert-doc.html#divert_open

        Returns:
        this instance to allow call chaining (e.g. Windivert w = new WinDivert("true").open())
        Throws:
        WinDivertException - Whenever the DLL call sets a LastError different by 0 (Success) or 997 (Overlapped I/O is in progress)

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Indicates if there is currently an open handle.
        Returns:
        True if the handle is open, false otherwise

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the handle opened by open.

        The remapped function is WinDivertClose: 

        
 BOOL WinDivertClose(
      __in HANDLE handle
 );

        For more info on the C call visit: http://reqrypt.org/windivert-doc.html#divert_close """

      • recv

        public Packet recv()
            throws WinDivertException
        Receives a diverted packet that matched the filter.
        The return value is a packet.

        The remapped function is WinDivertRecv: 

        
 BOOL WinDivertRecv(
      __in HANDLE handle,
      __out PVOID pPacket,
      __in UINT packetLen,
      __out_opt PWINDIVERT_ADDRESS pAddr,
      __out_opt UINT *recvLen
 );

        For more info on the C call visit: http://reqrypt.org/windivert-doc.html#divert_recv

        Returns:
        A Packet instance
        Throws:
        WinDivertException - Whenever the DLL call sets a LastError different by 0 (Success) or 997 (Overlapped I/O is in progress)

      • recv

        public Packet recv(int bufsize)
            throws WinDivertException
        Receives a diverted packet that matched the filter.
        The return value is a packet.

        The remapped function is WinDivertRecv: 

        
 BOOL WinDivertRecv(
      __in HANDLE handle,
      __out PVOID pPacket,
      __in UINT packetLen,
      __out_opt PWINDIVERT_ADDRESS pAddr,
      __out_opt UINT *recvLen
 );

        For more info on the C call visit: http://reqrypt.org/windivert-doc.html#divert_recv

        Parameters:
        bufsize - The size for the buffer to allocate
        Returns:
        A Packet instance
        Throws:
        WinDivertException - Whenever the DLL call sets a LastError different by 0 (Success) or 997 (Overlapped I/O is in progress)

      • send

        public int send(Packet packet)
         throws WinDivertException
        Injects a packet into the headers stack.
        Recalculates the checksum before sending.
        The return value is the number of bytes actually sent.

        The injected packet may be one received from recv, or a modified version, or a completely new packet. Injected packets can be captured and diverted again by other WinDivert handles with lower priorities.

        The remapped function is WinDivertSend: 

        
 BOOL WinDivertSend(
      __in HANDLE handle,
      __in PVOID pPacket,
      __in UINT packetLen,
      __in PWINDIVERT_ADDRESS pAddr,
      __out_opt UINT *sendLen
 );

        For more info on the C call visit: http://reqrypt.org/windivert-doc.html#divert_send

        Parameters:
        packet - The Packet to send
        Returns:
        The number of bytes actually sent
        Throws:
        WinDivertException - Whenever the DLL call sets a LastError different by 0 (Success) or 997 (Overlapped I/O is in progress)

      • send

        public int send(Packet packet,
                boolean recalculateChecksum,
                Enums.CalcChecksumsOption... options)
         throws WinDivertException
        Injects a packet into the headers stack.
        Recalculates the checksum before sending unless recalculateChecksum=false is passed:
        • If recalculateChecksum=true then checksums are calculated using the given options.
        • If recalculateChecksum=false then options are ignored.
        The return value is the number of bytes actually sent.

        The injected packet may be one received from recv, or a modified version, or a completely new packet. Injected packets can be captured and diverted again by other WinDivert handles with lower priorities.

        The remapped function is WinDivertSend: 

        
 BOOL WinDivertSend(
      __in HANDLE handle,
      __in PVOID pPacket,
      __in UINT packetLen,
      __in PWINDIVERT_ADDRESS pAddr,
      __out_opt UINT *sendLen
 );

        For more info on the C call visit: http://reqrypt.org/windivert-doc.html#divert_send

        Parameters:
        packet - The Packet to send
        recalculateChecksum - Whether to recalculate the checksums or pass the packet as is.
        options - A set of options to use when recalculating checksums.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes actually sent
        Throws:
        WinDivertException - Whenever the DLL call sets a LastError different by 0 (Success) or 997 (Overlapped I/O is in progress)

      • getParam

        public long getParam(Enums.Param param)
        Get a WinDivert parameter. See Param for the list of parameters.

        The remapped function is WinDivertGetParam: 

        
 BOOL WinDivertGetParam(
      __in HANDLE handle,
      __in WINDIVERT_PARAM param,
      __out UINT64 *pValue
 );

        For more info on the C call visit: http://reqrypt.org/windivert-doc.html#divert_get_param

        Parameters:
        param - The param to set
        Returns:
        The value for the parameter

 BOOL WinDivertSetParam(
